name: Pondok Lembah Dukuh Homestay
address: Jl. Tirta Gangga Banjar Tanah Lenggis, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852, Indonesia
review 1:
This gotta be one of the best place i have been in Indonesia & SE Asia.
Just the location & the view in the morning are worth 42 stars.
On top of that you get very nice rooms, a welcoming family vibe & nice breakfast & lunch/dinner if you need.
As for visiting the ‚ÄòWater Gardens‚Äô, you don‚Äôt even need to take your bike/car. Just walk down across the rice fields and‚Ä¶ voila!
review 2:
Lovely homestay with a generous family. The views from all rooms are spectacular overlooking terraced rice fields and mountains. We enjoyed our huge breakfast from our patio.
A stroll down the stairs brings you to two cute,  private pools overlooking the fields. Fresh mountain water flows through them and it's crystal clear. We took the scenic walk to the Water Palace. The pathway runs alongside right next door to Tirta Gangga for 300 mtrs.
We were only meant to stay one night, ended up for two. We will be back here.
review 3: This place is paradise. I stayed in the house which is not with the other houses but you have to walk through the jungle a little. The view was amazing and there were no neighbours around. The PERFECT place for meditation and introspection. I stayed there for 10 days. Every morning I woke up with a smile. Another day in paradise! ‚ù§Ô∏è
review 4:
Quiet and peaceful homestay near Tirta Gangga with the most fantastic views! The weather was bad during our 3d2n stay here so we were at the homestay for most of the time. Always nice to wake up and see the vast rice fields in front. The owner was nice to offer mie goreng for dinner for 25k when it rained so hard we couldn‚Äôt get out. The open bathroom was interesting. No ceiling, so there‚Äôs good air circulation, but could be a bit embarrassing on certain situations.

There is a pool few steps below the homestay but never got the chance to use it due to the consistent rain.

Generous breakfast. Banana pancake and mix of fruits including rambutan and pandan cake. Coffee was included as well. And hot water available is available upon request.
review 5: Fabulous location with views across to Mt Lempuyang but minimal facilities. No hot water, no tea or coffee making, scant breakfast. Eat next door at Pondok Batur Indah.

name: Pondok Batur Indah Home Stay
address: Jalan Raya Ababi Budakeling, Br Tanahlengis, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852, Indonesia
review 1: Very friendly family, good place to rest. Also only a short walk to the holy swimming waters where you can swim in with the fishes. Gede will also drive you to the animal market (early in the morning) which is definitely worth viewing!
review 2:
This place has a restaurant with excellent food and reasonable prices. The view
from the terrace is supurb.
review 3: A small homestay with 5 cottages built on a terrace with each cottage overlooking the Maha Valley with Mt. Seraya on the horizon. Beautiful and quiet. Friendly welcome from the owner and his family. Highly recommend.
review 4:
What a place, so quiet and relaxed.
Clean. Breakfast and dinner were great in their restaurant. Gede, his wife and staff were so friendly and helpfull.
Our 2nd time, will be back.
review 5: Incredible place!! Love the food and great view and the host is the best üëå

name: Alamku Bungalow
address: Tirta Gangga, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852, Indonesia
review 1: Great owner, Made, thank you for such a beautiful place you  have made. It's a pleasure to stay in this silent and natural area in a new and comfortable house. I just stay some photos of this unbelievable place them would be better than any words
review 2: A very quite and comfortable home stay. Very clean inside, hot water, comfortable bed (one big queen size bed). The room is spacious and nicely decorated, there is a  pretty view on the rice terraces and a stylish garden around the place. A good home made breakfast is included. We enjoyed our stay very much and would recommend this place for those who seek for comfort and relaxed atmosphere.
review 3: Very very very nice homestay!! Made took so good care of us, so friendly, so helpful and gave any support we needed. So bad, that we had just time for one night. Thanx for everything, Made!!! Daniel and Antje
review 4: A little paradise. We stayed for a week and it was just perfect.

name: Pondok Alam Bukit
address: Tanah Lengis - Desa Ababi, Tirtagangga, Karangasem, Ababi, Abang, Karangasem Regency, Bali 80852, Indonesia
review 1: A charming B&B and E (evening meal) Even though it's a short walk from Tirta Gangga, Alam Bukit is a nice place to stay. Ktuc and his family make you feel like you've come home. They will help with any requests. The food is excellent and very Bali. Alum Bukit is an ideal place to just chill.
review 2:
Great stay in this area!

Our host was also our guide for the 2 days we stayed at their home. They have 3 small independent houses they rent and are willing to accommodate for their needs, be it deliciously cooked meals or private transportation around the area or towards the next destination.
review 3: Lovely small guesthouse run by a very nice family.  Just a short hike down hill to the water palace.  They cooked up a nice evening meal for me at a very reasonable price.   Good internet that never let me down.
review 4: We stayed 4 nights, the room and the view are really nice and the owner very kind, but I found it too expensive for what it is. For 360 000 idr/night there is no AC and the fan doesn't work (it turns so slow that on or off it makes no difference, really!), there is no restaurant and to eat at night you have to play Indiana Jones to go down to the main road through jungly stairs with your own light or go to another homestay facing many barking dogs, also the hygiene of the breakfast fruit salad should be considerably improved. For the rest it is a really nice place with a considerate owner, I just think a fair price should be around 200 000 idr considering the other homestays we have stayed.
review 5: I have been staying always in the nicest hotel with budget,and this room one of my favorite,cos i felt like having my own villa even tho only hotel room but has incredible view of nature.. much love for this place . Hopefully the owner will get success for beginner in their business cos he deserve it.

name: Geriasemalung
address: Indonesia, Bali, Kabupaten Karangasem, Kec. Abang, Ababi, Jl raya abadi
review 1:
A real hidden gem! This place is beautiful - not only the view, but also the garden is stunning. If I had to give it a name it would be "the mountain sanctuary". It felt very calm and is the ideal place if you're looking to disconnect from all the buzz Bali has to offer. It's also a small place, so you won't have many other guests. It's only 4 bungalows for now...

The staff is also exceptional. Michiyo, the Japanese owner, is very friendly and we enjoyed a nice conversation over a nice cup of tea upon my arrival. And the breakfast I had was also very nice...the staff is very attentive and adaptive to your needs.

I was at first worried about missing AC, but not to worry. It's surprisingly cool as it's up the hill and you have a constant breeze...I did not feel uncomfortable at all.

I will definitely come back in the future and urge you to check out this place. Even if it's only for a night...it's unique!
review 2: Undoubtedly it was my best weekend in Bali. Rooms are perfect but especially garden, trees and jungle surrounded us. The view until the ocean is like a miracle. This hotel is like you are meditating in a temple: peace. Service was also very good.
review 3: This place was so beautiful,and very peaceful and very quiet place to stay. The room is very clean, private with balcony and on the top of the hill with the natural view is so amazing. It's very recomended for those who like to do yoga, and meditation. Very close to Tirtagangga water palace, you also can walk down around the village, and traditional local market. The price was so reasonable, with breakfast included. And also very friendly staff. What an amazing place..wanna come back again. üòäüëç
review 4:
I have visited this area of Bali many times since 1988 and this is the best place to stay in Tirtagangga. Perched atop a verdant hill, this cozy accommodation commands a magnificent view over lush sawah and bukit farther to the Lombok Strait.  The rooms are always kept clean and comfortable and the garden is so beautiful. The owner is helphul and the staff are friendly. I am glad to hear they resume the operation after two years suspension with some renovations to the rooms.  Secluded and quiet, an ideal place for musing; never for the party type. If you need some activity, you can hire a veteran local guide for trekking around this pristine countryside, which still keeps the atomosphere of Ubud decades ago. Or enjoy swimming in the pool in the Tirtagangga Palace just 10 minutes down the hill, or snorkeling in Amed, only about 20 minutes by motorbike.
It was at their restaurant that I savored the truly excellent tasty arak. It was so fruity and just out of this world!
review 5: Geriasemalung is a really serene and restful place to stay. It offers a pleasant, warm-colored room and a clean bed that ensures a good night's sleep. The view of the rice field, city, hills, and beach from the room is amazing. They serve western breakfast as well as some traditional local breakfast options. Geriasemalung is the greatest place to get away from the crowds and spend a wonderful stay in Bali!(^^)

name: Pandan Guest House
address: HHPJ+FPC, Jl. Raya Ababi, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852, Indonesia

name: Pondok Batur Indah Restaurant
address: Br Tanahlengis, Jalan Raya Ababi Budakeling, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852, Indonesia
review 2: Very nice place, food is simple and delicious
review 3: Amazing food, best so far in Bali. Very authentic experience and friendly owner. We defintely would come back!

name: Kolam renang selompong
address: Jl. Tirta Gangga Banjar Tanah Lenggis, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852, Indonesia

name: Leging View pondok
address: Jl. Raya Ababi, Abang, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852, Indonesia
review 1: A hidden gem very close to Tirta Gangga. You can actually walk to the water palace from your room, through a trek in the forest which is an add-on to the experience. Beautiful gardens, great breakfast included, our bungalow had an amazing view from the bed, hot water, fan (no air-conditioning but no need for it). The owner Budi is such a nice guy, he was always around if we needed anything, gave us some tourist tips and was happy to share his knowledge of the area and Balinese culture. 10 out of 10
review 2:
Great view and really nice room. Even though it looks far from the main sightseeing, there is a shortcut that goes almost directly into the water palace. Great value for what it offers.
Owner was really helpful and available for all kind of possible tours and activities around the area.
review 3:
beautiful quiet place close to the gate of heaven.  (20 min with a scooter)
the owner is super friendly and the breakfast was delicious!  just sitting on the terrace and enjoying the view is already a reason to come back here!
review 4: Really beautiful homestay!  Great access for a jungle walk too. View is amazing and Budhi is an absolutely amazing host!
review 5:
Relax
Calm
Peaceful
Owner very kind and so super nice
Here has scooter to rent (70k)
Restaurant also very good
Room is clean
Bathroom has hot shower
No AC but fan is enough
No TV but nature sound is all around
Google pins is correct
